cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 420 mi SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Expected to turn north-northeast later today, cross the northeast Gulf and make landfall on the northwest Florida coast Thursday, then accelerate northeastward along/just offshore the SE U.S. coast toward the Carolinas and western Atlantic.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-west Florida coast between Anclote River and Indian Pass

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch: Anclote River FL to Indian Pass FL; Tropical Storm Watch: west of Indian Pass to Walton/Bay County line
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Gulf coast of Florida then Atlantic coast from northern Florida through Georgia and the Carolinas
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) possible Friday night into early Saturday with a small chance (8 %) of 50-kt gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge possible (generally <3 ft) if the center passes just offshore; major inundation not currently anticipated.
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain could total 3–6 inches with localized higher amounts, producing ponding and brief flash-flood issues.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes in rain bands and short-fused squalls may disrupt cargo and crane operations.
